edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption

Class ScCTREncRandomIV

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.midLayer.symmetricCrypto.encryption.ScCTREncRandomIV
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CTREnc, SymmetricEnc, Cpa, Eav, EncSecLevel, Indistinguishable, SecurityLevel

    public class ScCTREncRandomIV
extends java.lang.Object
implements CTREnc
    This class performs the randomized Counter Mode encryption and decryption. By definition, this encryption scheme is CPA-secure.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Yael Ejgenberg)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ScCTREncRandomIV

        public ScCTREncRandomIV()
        Default constructor. Uses default implementation of prp and SecureRandom.

      • ScCTREncRandomIV

        public ScCTREncRandomIV(java.lang.String prpName)
                 throws FactoriesException
        By passing a specific Pseudorandom permutation we are setting the type of encryption scheme.

        This constructor gets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and is responsible for creating a corresponding instance.

        Parameters:
        prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
        Throws:
        FactoriesException

      • ScCTREncRandomIV

        public ScCTREncRandomIV(java.lang.String prpName,
                        java.lang.String randNumGenAlg)
                 throws FactoriesException,
                        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        By passing a specific Pseudorandom permutation we are setting the type of encryption scheme.

        This constructor gets the name of a Pseudorandom permutation and is responsible for creating a corresponding instance.

        It also gets the name of a Random Number Generator Algorithm to use to generate the source of randomness

        Parameters:
        prpName - the name of a specific Pseudorandom permutation, for example "AES".
        randNumGenAlg - the name of the RNG algorithm, for example "SHA1PRNG".
        Throws:
        FactoriesException - if the given prpName is not a valid prp name.
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the given randNumGenAlg is not a valid random number generator algorithm.

      • ScCTREncRandomIV

        public ScCTREncRandomIV(PseudorandomPermutation prp)
        The Pseudorandom Permutation passed to the constructor of this class determines the type of encryption that will be performed. For ex: if the PRP is TripleDes, the after constructing this object we hole a CTR-TripleDes encryption scheme.
        Parameters:
        prp - the specific Pseudorandom permutation.

      • ScCTREncRandomIV

        public ScCTREncRandomIV(PseudorandomPermutation prp,
                        java.security.SecureRandom random)
        By passing a specific Pseudorandom permutation we are setting the type of encryption scheme.

        Random object sets the source of randomness.

        Parameters:
        prp - the specific Pseudorandom permutation.
        random - SecureRandom object to set the random member

    • Method Detail

      • getAlgorithmName

        public java.lang.String getAlgorithmName()
        This function returns a string that is the result of concatenating "CTRwith" with the name of the underlying PRP. For example: "CTRwithAES"
        Specified by:
        getAlgorithmName in interface SymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        the name of this symmetric encryption.

      • decrypt

        public Plaintext decrypt(SymmetricCiphertext ciphertext)
        This function performs the decryption of a ciphertext returning the corresponding decrypted plaintext. It assumes that the IV passed as part of the IVCiphertext is also the one that was used to encrypt the corresponding plaintext.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        ciphertext - The Ciphertext to decrypt. Must be of type IVCiphertext.
        Returns:
        the decrypted plaintext.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument ciphertext is not specifically of type IVCiphertext.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.

      • setKey

        public void setKey(javax.crypto.SecretKey secretKey)
            throws java.security.InvalidKeyException
        Supply the encryption scheme with a Secret Key.
        Specified by:
        setKey in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        secretKey - secret key.
        Throws:
        java.security.InvalidKeyException - if the given key does not match this encryption scheme.

        public boolean isKeySet()
        Checks if this object has been given a SecretKey .
        Specified by:
        isKeySet in interface SymmetricEnc
        Returns:
        true, if already initialized.

        false, otherwise.

      • generateKey

        public javax.crypto.SecretKey generateKey(java.security.spec.AlgorithmParameterSpec keyParams)
                                   throws java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException
        Generates a secret key to initialize this encryption with IV object. This function delegates the generation of the key to the underlying PRP. It should only be used if the Secret Key is not a string of random bits of a specified length.
        Specified by:
        generateKey in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        keyParams - parameters needed to create the key.
        Returns:
        the generated secret key
        Throws:
        java.security.spec.InvalidParameterSpecException - if hte given keyParams does not match the prp type.

        Generates a secret key to initialize this encryption with IV object.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        keySize - the length of the key to generate.
        Returns:

      • encrypt

        public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext)
        This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the system choose the random IV.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.

      • encrypt

        public SymmetricCiphertext encrypt(Plaintext plaintext,
                                   byte[] iv)
                            throws javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        This function encrypts a plaintext. It lets the user choose the random IV.
        Specified by:
        encrypt in interface SymmetricEnc
        Parameters:
        plaintext - should be an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        iv - random bytes to use in the encryption pf the message.
        Returns:
        an IVCiphertext, which contains the IV used and the encrypted data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if no secret key was set.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given plaintext is not an instance of ByteArrayPlaintext.
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException - if the given IV length is not as the block size.
